subject: Politics
title: Russia's Resurgence
description: A quick win: understand Russia's Resurgence.

hook.text: Russia's economy is smaller than Italy's. Yet it invaded Ukraine and defied the West. Size isn't everything.

buildup.text: After the USSR collapsed, Russia declined for a decade. Under Putin, it rebuilt military power and ambition.

discovery.text: Russia uses energy as a weapon. It supplies Europe's gas and threatens cutoffs to gain political leverage.

twist.text: The Ukraine war backfired on Russia. Europe diversified energy and NATO grew stronger with new members.

climax.text: Russia's long-term outlook is weak: aging population, shrinking economy, and deepening isolation from the West.

punchline.text: Russia punches above its weight. But weight eventually matters.

quiz.question: How has Russia used energy as a geopolitical weapon?
options: By supplying Europe's gas and threatening cutoffs for political leverage
By building nuclear power plants worldwide
By controlling global solar panel production
